Step04:
You can now use two <clr:0000>travel medallions<clr:ffff> to
instantly return to any location you have set.
The pad can hold one more <clr:0000>travel medallion<clr:ffff>.

Once <clr:0000>15 regions have been mapped<clr:ffff>, a third

medallions<clr:ffff> are accessible from your Key Items.
Name: Presenting: The Travel Medallion!
Step01:
The Purah Pad has a feature called the
<clr:0000>travel medallion<clr:ffff>, which allows you to set a
location that you can instantly return to.
But the <clr:0000>prototype<clr:ffff> you need to activate this
feature was left at the Akkala Ancient Tech Lab.

It's rumored that the lab has been taken over
by intruders...
Complete:
You gave Robbie all the data he needed to
upgrade the Purah Pad once again. You can
now use three <clr:0000>travel medallions <clr:ffff>to instantly
return to any location you have set. The travel
medallions are accessible from your Key Items.
Step02:
The Purah Pad has a feature called the
<clr:0000>travel medallion<clr:ffff>, which allows you to set a
location that you can instantly return to.
You picked up the prototype needed to activate
this feature from the Akkala Ancient Tech Lab.

Give it to Robbie at the Purah Pad Research
Lab near Hateno Village.
Step03:
You can now use the <clr:0000>travel medallion<clr:ffff> to
instantly return to any location you have set.
The pad can hold two more <clr:0000>travel medallions<clr:ffff>.

Once <clr:0000>10 regions have been mapped<clr:ffff>, a second
travel medallion can be activated. The travel
medallion is accessible from your Key Items.
